verses.text: 掃羅仍向主的門徒發恐嚇兇殺的話。他到大祭司那裡，

words.note: Refers to God or Jesus in biblical context.
Describes words filled with cruelty and intent to kill.
Specific religious office in Judaism, implying a named individual here.

verses.text: 要求他發公函給大馬士革各會堂，如果發現奉行這道的人，准他連男帶女緝拿到耶路撒冷。

words.note: Refers to Jewish places of worship.
Often used in religious or formal contexts for 'observing' or 'following' a teaching/doctrine.
Refers to early Christianity as 'the Way' (cf. Acts 9:2).
An idiomatic expression meaning 'men and women alike' or 'including both sexes'.

verses.text: 他快到大馬士革的時候，忽然有光從天上向他四面照射。

words.note: Forms a 'when' clause: '快到大馬士革的時候' (when he was approaching Damascus).
Literally 'above the sky/heaven', contextually 'from heaven'.

verses.text: 他仆倒在地，聽見有聲音對他說：「掃羅，掃羅！你為甚麼迫害我？」

words.note: Often used to describe falling face down, especially in reverence or shock.
Resultative compound: 'listen and perceive'.

verses.text: 他說：「主啊，你是誰？」主說：「我就是你所迫害的耶穌。

words.note: Used as a title for God or Jesus.
Indicates exclamation or entreaty.
Used as a title for God or Jesus.
Emphasizes the identity.
Forms a noun phrase '所 + V + 的' meaning 'that which is V-ed' or 'the one who is V-ed'.
Forms 'the one whom you persecuted'.

verses.text: 起來，進城去！你應當作的事，一定有人告訴你。」

words.note: Used as a directional complement to indicate rising motion.
Indicates motion away, or a command/suggestion.
Forms an attributive or nominalizer (the thing that...)

verses.text: 同行的人，聽見聲音，卻看不見人，只是目瞪口呆地站在那裡。

words.note: Resultative compound verb, 'listen to completion'.
Resultative compound verb with negative.
Idiom describing a state of shock.
Connects an adverbial (often an adjective or idiom) to a verb.

verses.text: 掃羅從地上爬起來，睜開眼睛，卻甚麼也看不見。他們牽著他的手，領他進大馬士革。

words.note: Describes getting up from a prone position.
Resultative compound verb, 'open to completion'.
Used in negative sentences to mean 'anything'.
Used with 甚麼 (shénme) to reinforce the negative.
Resultative compound verb with negative.
著 (zhe) indicates an ongoing action or state.

verses.text: 他三天都不能看見甚麼，不吃也不喝。

words.note: Indicates that the condition applies to the entire duration.
Resultative compound verb, 'look to completion'.
Used in negative sentences to mean 'anything'.
Used to link parallel negative clauses.

verses.text: 在大馬士革，有一個門徒名叫亞拿尼亞，主在異象中對他說：「亞拿尼亞！」他說：「主啊，我在這裡。」

words.note: Lit. 'gate follower', referring to one who follows a master's teaching.
Often used as a suffix to denote 'in the midst of'.
Indicates exclamation, surprise, or a plea.

verses.text: 主說：「起來，到那叫直街的路上去，要在猶大家裡找一個大數人，名叫掃羅。你看，他正在禱告，

words.note: A specific street in Damascus.
Directional complement indicating movement towards a place.
Refers to the house or family of Judah.
Often used as a locative suffix.
A verb-object compound, 'to tell a prayer'.

verses.text: 在異象中他看見一個人，名叫亞拿尼亞，進來為他按手，使他可以再看得見。」

words.note: Often used as a locative suffix with nouns.
A resultative verb compound: 'look' + 'perceive'.
A verb-object compound, 'to press hands'.
A potential complement: 'can see'.

verses.text: 但亞拿尼亞回答：「主啊，我聽見許多人說起這個人，他在耶路撒冷作了許多苦害你聖徒的事；

words.note: A resultative verb compound: 'listen' + 'perceive'.
A directional verb compound indicating 'to start speaking about'.
Literally 'bitter harm'.
Literally 'holy disciples'.

verses.text: 並且他在這裡得到祭司長的授權，要捆綁所有求告你名的人。」

words.note: A verb-object compound: 'seek to tell/declare'.

verses.text: 主對他說：「你去吧！這人是我揀選的器皿，為要把我的名傳給外族人、君王和以色列人。

words.note: Figuratively means a tool or instrument for a purpose.

words.definition: in order to, for the purpose of

words.note: Introduces a direct object that precedes the verb.
Literally 'outside ethnic people'.

verses.text: 我要指示他，為了我的名他必須受許多的苦。」
亞拿尼亞就去了，進了那家，為掃羅按手，說：「掃羅弟兄，在你來的路上向你顯現的耶穌，就是主，差我來使你可以看見，又被聖靈充滿。」

words.note: A specific religious action for blessing or healing.
Used in Christian contexts to refer to fellow believers.
Refers to the third person of the Trinity.

verses.text: 立刻有鱗狀的東西，從掃羅的眼裡掉下來，他就能看見了。於是起來，受了洗，

words.note: Refers to the Christian sacrament of baptism.

verses.text: 吃過了飯，就有氣力了。他和大馬士革的門徒一同住了幾天，
隨即在各會堂傳講耶穌，說他是 神的兒子。

words.note: Refers to Jewish places of worship and assembly.
A verb-verb compound, similar to '傳道' but emphasizing the verbal act of proclaiming.

verses.text: 聽見的人都很驚奇，說：「在耶路撒冷殘害求告這名的，不是這個人嗎？他來這裡不是要緝拿他們交給祭司長嗎？」

words.definition: to call on, to appeal to
words.note: Often used in religious contexts for praying or invoking a deity.

words.definition: to want to, to intend to

words.note: More formal or legal term for arrest.

verses.text: 然而掃羅更加有能力，駁倒住在大馬士革的猶太人，證明耶穌是基督。

words.note: Implies refuting someone to the point of 'knocking them down' argumentatively.

verses.text: 過了許多日子，猶太人商議要殺掉掃羅；

words.definition: to want to, to intend to

verses.heading: Saul’s Escape from Damascus

verses.text: 但他們的計謀給掃羅知道了。他們就在各城門日夜把守，要殺掉他。

words.note: Indicates the agent in a passive voice sentence.

words.definition: to want to, to intend to

verses.text: 於是他的門徒就漏夜用大籃子把他從城牆上縋下去。

words.note: Lit. 'leaking night', implying stealthily through the night.
Used to move the object before the verb for emphasis or clarity.
Used as a locative suffix indicating 'on top of' or 'above'.

verses.text: 掃羅到了耶路撒冷，想要接近門徒，但大家都怕他，不信他是個門徒。

words.note: Lit. 'gate/sect follower'
Lit. 'gate/sect follower'

verses.heading: Saul Returns to Jerusalem

verses.text: 只有巴拿巴接待他，帶他去見使徒，把他怎樣在路上看見主，主向他說話，和他怎樣在大馬士革奉耶穌的名放膽講道，都講了出來。

words.note: Lit. 'sent disciple'

words.definition: on the way, on the road
in the name of, respectfully offer

words.note: Lit. 'release courage'
Lit. 'speak the Way/doctrine'

verses.text: 於是掃羅在耶路撒冷和門徒一同出入，奉主的名放膽講道，

words.note: Lit. 'gate/sect follower'
Implies freely moving about and associating with.

words.definition: in the name of, respectfully offer

words.note: Lit. 'release courage'
Lit. 'speak the Way/doctrine'

verses.text: 並且與講希臘話的猶太人談論辯駁，那些人卻想下手殺他。

words.note: Refers to Jewish people.
Often implies taking violent or decisive action.

verses.text: 弟兄們知道了，就送他到該撒利亞，差他往大數去。

words.note: Refers to fellow believers.

verses.text: 那時猶太、加利利、撒瑪利亞各處的教會，都得到平安，被建立起來，存著敬畏主的心過生活，並且因著聖靈的激勵，人數增多起來。

words.note: Used as a verb complement indicating an upward movement or beginning of an action.
A verb-object compound, 'to live a life'.
Used as a verb complement indicating an upward movement or beginning of an action.

verses.text: 彼得周遊各地的時候，也到了住在呂大的聖徒那裡。
verses.heading: Peter Heals Aeneas

verses.text: 他遇見一個人，名叫以尼雅，害了癱瘓病，在床上躺臥了八年。

words.note: A locative noun phrase.

verses.text: 彼得對他說：「以尼雅，耶穌基督醫好你了！起來，收好你的褥子！」他就立刻起來。
所有住在呂大和沙崙的人，看見了他就歸向主。
在約帕有一個女門徒，名叫戴比莎，希臘話叫多加；她為人樂善好施。

words.note: Lit. 'gate follower'
An idiom describing someone who loves to do good and give generously.

verses.heading: Peter Raises Dorcas

verses.text: 那時，她因病死了；有人把她洗淨了，停放在樓上。
呂大靠近約帕，門徒聽說彼得在那邊，就派兩個人去求他，說：「請到我們那邊去，不要耽延！」
彼得就動身，跟他們一同去。到了之後，他們領他上樓。所有寡婦站在彼得旁邊哭，把多加和她們在一起的時候所做的內衣外衣拿給他看。
彼得叫大家出去之後，就跪下來禱告，然後轉過身來對著屍體說：「戴比莎，起來！」她就睜開眼睛，一看見彼得，就坐了起來。

words.note: Used with 就 (jiù) to mean 'as soon as... then...'

verses.text: 彼得伸手扶她起來，叫聖徒們和寡婦都進來，把多加活活地交給他們。

words.note: Indicates upward movement or beginning an action.
Lit. 'holy disciple'.
Marks object of a verb placed before the verb.
Repetition emphasizes the state of being alive.

verses.text: 這事傳遍了約帕，就有很多人信了主。

words.note: Used to refer to God or Jesus Christ.

verses.text: 此後，彼得在約帕一個製皮工人西門的家裡住了許多日子。
